qas.question: How much of the short tons of bombs were dropped during the day?
What two cities had 500 short tons of bombs dropped on them during the end of October?
Liverpool had how many short tons dropped on it?
What was targeted with 12 short tons of bombs?
Which was targeted more heavily, bomber or fighter command airfields?

context: Loge continued during October. According to German sources, 9,000 short tons (8,200 t) of bombs were dropped in that month, of which about <a0_0>10 percent<a0_0/> of which was dropped in daylight. Over 6,000 short tons (5,400 t) was aimed at London during the night. Attacks on <a1_0>Birmingham and Coventry<a1_0/> were subject to 500 short tons (450 t) of bombs between them in the last 10 days of October. Liverpool suffered <a2_0>200<a2_0/> short tons (180 t) of bombs dropped. Hull and Glasgow were attacked, but 800 short tons (730 t) of bombs were spread out all over Britain. <a3_0>The Metropolitan-Vickers works in Manchester<a3_0/> was targeted and 12 short tons (11 t) of bombs dropped against it. Little tonnage was dropped on Fighter Command airfields; <a4_0>Bomber Command airfields<a4_0/> were hit instead.
